Class OpenApiHandler

java.lang.Object
uk.co.spudsoft.vertx.rest.OpenApiHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
io.vertx.core.Handler<io.vertx.ext.web.RoutingContext>
public class OpenApiHandler extends Object implements io.vertx.core.Handler<io.vertx.ext.web.RoutingContext>
Vert.x web handler for outputting openapi definitions based on RestEasy Jax-RS endpoints.
Author:
jtalbut

    static class 
    OpenApiHandler.UiHandler
    The Vertx handler for converting a request into an HTML page that uses OpenAPI-Explorer to reference /openapi.yaml.

  • Constructor Details

    • OpenApiHandler

      public OpenApiHandler(jakarta.ws.rs.core.Application app, io.swagger.v3.oas.integration.api.OpenAPIConfiguration openApiConfiguration, String basePath, @Nullable String openApiExplorerUrl)
      Constructor.
      Parameters:
      app - The Jax-RS application, typically the Main class.
      openApiConfiguration - The Open API configuration, may be null.
      basePath - Base path to be prepended to any paths.
      openApiExplorerUrl - The URL to use to access Open API Explorer, to override the default value from DEFAULT_OPENAPI_EXPLORER_URL.

  • Method Details

    • getUiHandler

      public OpenApiHandler.UiHandler getUiHandler()
      UiHandler factory method.
      Returns:
      a new UiHandler object.

    • setOpenContextId

      public OpenApiHandler setOpenContextId(String openContextId)
      The Java OpenAPI implementation caches the OpenID context per context ID. In live usage this is almost never an issue because there is only one OpenAPI configuration required in a given service. However this completely breaks unit tests, that want to use different configurations. For that purpose it is possible to set a context ID.
      Parameters:
      openContextId - The Open API context ID to use.
      Returns:
      this for fluent usage.

    • handle

      public void handle(io.vertx.ext.web.RoutingContext event)
